[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Gaia Object Generator (GOG) defines requirements for simulating catalog and auxiliary datasets.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: GOG enables data simulation independent of GASS telemetry and ESAC databases.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: GOG integrates with the Universe Model and GaiaSimu libraries.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: GOG uses XML-based configuration for simulation parameters.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: GOG supports Linux, UNIX, and macOS environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: GOG depends on GaiaSimu libraries for data processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: GOG adheres to Universe Model ICD specifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: GOG optimizes memory for large-scale simulations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: GOG supports single-threaded and distributed computing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: GOG is adaptable to various processing needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: GOG links with Gaia archives for data validation.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: GOG generates modular astronomical simulations for research and analysis.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: GOG is designed for CU researchers and astronomers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: GOG focuses on pre-processed data simulation rather than real-time processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: GOG relies on accurate error models and input datasets from CUs.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Universe Model:  Framework for simulating celestial objects.
Catalog Data:  Data representing celestial objects.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: DPAC:  Data Processing and Analysis Consortium

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with the Gaia main database and Universe Model ICD.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall synchronize outputs with MDB archives for compliance.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall ensure that simulation outputs conform to Universe Model ICD (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide tools for customizable error modeling (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall offer a user-friendly interface for parameter specification.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall maintain logs for debugging and performance tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process single-source simulations within 2 CPU seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support concurrent simulation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall ensure database output adheres to Universe Model ICD specifications.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store and retrieve large datasets efficiently.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall be scalable and independent of specific environments.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with DPAC product assurance standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall follow industry standards for data security and storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log actions and scale resources dynamically.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain stability during deployments.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional, compliance, and performance testing ensure simulation accuracy and efficiency.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, training guides, and reference materials.
[SEC] 5. References: Universe Model ICD, GaiaSimu Library Documentation, DPAC Software Assurance Plan, and MDB Data Model Specifications.
